abstract: The pharmaceutical company and a subsidiary will pay a total of $60 million to resolve accusations that it paid doctors in several countries to prescribe its drugs.
snippet: The pharmaceutical company and a subsidiary will pay a total of $60 million to resolve accusations that it paid doctors in several countries to prescribe its drugs.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced on Tuesday that it had reached a $45 million settlement with Pfizer to resolve charges that subsidiaries of Pfizer and Wyeth, which it acquired in 2009, bribed overseas doctors and other health care workers to increase sales of their drugs.

headline.main: Pfizer Settles U.S. Charges of Bribing Doctors Abroad
headline.print_headline: Pfizer Settles U.S. Charges Of Bribing Doctors Abroad
